storyInfo: Everyone spends the night in a village, with a place found for the ill. Bagpipe and Reed chat about their pasts. Meanwhile, Harmonie doesn't expect to hear news of Reed's arson, and her split-second reaction when she does is caught by Fischer.

attributes.content: *sigh* Never imagined we'd get a hot meal indoors safe and sound, after so many days on the run.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: That Bagpipe girl must be the darling of everyone. We were all gushing to her about how good her stew was.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Mm, she's definitely not bad on that front.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: How's your discussion on settling down? Has it been smooth?
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: We're all decided. Anyone who can't handle rushing'll stay behind. They'll borrow two storehouses to tuck away in for the next two days.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Refugees scuffling with caravans but never actually stealing anything, that's dead common. The law won't get hung up on that.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: In a few days, they won't be mentioning it on the radio anymore, and we won't need to hide. Then we can get to building our own houses.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Er, but the few with Oripathy'll be living a bit ways out from the village.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: The people here are very friendly.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: *sigh* Yeah, they are. If anyone sheltered us while we were still running, we wouldn't be in this sty of a state now.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Not that it's anyone's fault. Didn't used to be much hassle taking in a bunch of refugees or the like, but life's getting scarier for everyone now.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Look at Selmon, the colleen. If she and her brother had someplace to take them in, she wouldn't be running from settlement to settlement, kicking up all this fuss.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: She could spend the night in the village like us, but she's all stubborn about hiding outside. Since she stole a man's stockbeast here once, see, and now she's awkward about running into him...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: ...*sigh* You never heard it from me. You let her know, she'll be on my case about disrespecting her again.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Good evening...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Oh, Moran? What are you doing here, so dark out? I'll send you back while the lamps are still lit...
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Thank you, but I'm used to making my way in the dark by now...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: ...Is Reed here, if you don't mind?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You're looking for her? She went out on her own.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Maybe Reed's got something on her mind... Selmon hasn't spoken so much as a word to her since she got here.
attributes.name: Fionn

attributes.content: Don't worry, Bagpipe's gone to find her.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Hm... actually, put it this way. Our bigger concern is if Reed gets annoyed by the noise.
attributes.name: Ch'en

attributes.content: Whoa, sorry!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...It's alright.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, I wasn't watchin' out, didn't think there'd be anyone here. It all goes pitch dark every time they sound the bell. Takes a moment for my eyes to adjust.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Lucky it's you I ran into. Might've knocked anyone else clean over.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Thought they said they wouldn't need anyone on watch tonight, though?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I just... wanted to sit for a while outside.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, it's the smell of the hay, isn't it? Wonderful, that.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Hay?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Yeah, that's hay piles over there. Been ages since I was around the smell, so I came out to get a proper whiff of them.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Back when I was preppin' to get into military school, I'd have headaches from studyin' so much theory. So I'd just get onto a hay pile and lie back for a bit, and I'd feel right as rain again.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Mum always told me off for bein' lazy, said I shouldn't quit thinkin' about questions just because thinkin' gets too hard... but havin' too much stuff goin' on in your brain does wear a person out, y'know.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: So, give me your hand a sec?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Come on, here now, let's lie down together! Just for a bit!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'm not so good at thinkin' over stuff, so I might not be of much help to you, but the hay will be, I'm sure of it!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Hup—!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Bagpipe relaxes and lies back on the hay pile, lightly humming a folksong she learned just a while ago from the farmers.
A gentle night breeze passes by. Reed follows her suggestion, and takes a deep breath.
But what she smells isn't the aroma of hay—it is, instead, damp mud and ash.
When it hits me how I've spent three years without goin' home, it always feels so funny.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Think about it. The ground's waitin' for you to till it, the wheat's waitin' for you to reap it... Spend one year away, and you miss an entire go round of all the important stuff, every bit of it.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I can't even get my letters from home until the next time I'm back on Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Do you... miss home very much?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Course I do. You? Were you from County Hillock?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But I used to live in a city about the same as County Hillock... flushed red bricks, grey pavements. Buildings two or three floors high, flowering vines growing around the windows.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I... yearn after those peaceful times a lot.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: There were so many old books at home, and some manuscripts too. I liked to hide away in the study, and lock the door, so I wouldn't have to hear anyone talk to me.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, you had piles of family makin' a racket, then? Or was it visitors all the time?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...No, thankfully. Just—I could avoid so much trouble if I hid.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I could see into the street from the window in there. I'd see my parents come back after a day of work.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I would love to go back there, if I could.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh. So the place isn't...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I'm makin' it worse for you, aren't I?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: It's okay. It was all so long ago.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I might not be much different—to the ordinary people whose lives were ruined at County Hillock, or to these refugees leaving their home behind.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: They can all settle down here, and rebuild their houses... but—where is their homeland?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: And the ones who are—forced out even farther... where are they fleeing to?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Hmm... You're havin' trouble answerin' these questions just on your lonesome, aren't you?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Mm...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But I'm not sayin' it's no use thinkin' over them!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: If you can't come up with an answer alone, we can think together. Whenever I had a question I couldn't fill in, I'd always bother Chenchen about it.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: And later down the line, I'd prattle on at my captains... I mean, they found me annoyin' as flip, but still, they'd chat with me every time, help me solve issues.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What about you? You got anyone to speak your mind to? Like a sister or a schoolmate or someone in arms, that sort of...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: There's... my older sister.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: You don't get along much?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...No. I shouldn't be saying this. I shouldn't...
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Y'know, Selmon was right about one thing, actually. You're always sayin' 'no' out of habit.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But she misunderstood a little. It's when you're talkin' about yourself that you're most fond of sayin' 'no', like... och, I can't put it into words. It's like you're strainin' to break away from somethin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...I've been told something like that before.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, what? Really?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: She... saved me, and told me, I didn't have to seek death. That I could dodge destiny.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Outcast, eh. There's somethin' she would say.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I regret... I regret not having it in me to say anything more to her.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I want to ask her so badly—why save me?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: What... did she see in me?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Ohh. I'm not sure how she'd answer myself.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: But, y'know, Reed, why not ask yourself before askin' her? What do you see in yourself?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: My... self?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Oh, someone's over there.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: With the way they feel about, I think it's Moran... She can't see at night.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Gosh, why's she out here by herself, then?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Miss Moran! Need any help from us?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Oh, you just stand still there for a sec, we'll be right over.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Thank you.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Where's Reed, can I ask? They said, she'd gone out.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm right here.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: ...Sorry. Excuse me, but am I able to go with you?
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I don't mind where it is. I've still got some strength, I can work... and fight.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You want to... fight?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: I do. They all say I won't live much longer, that my only option's dying without a word in some corner.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I don't agree with that.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: 'If you want to survive as a Taran, then change workshops, and accept lower pay'. 'If you want to survive as with Oripathy, then move out, and get to the Infected neighborhood'...
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I'm done listening to all that.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: Reed, I used to not be this way, but then I met you.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: They tell me you're an Infected too. It's you who convinced Selmon and the rest to bring us here.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: You... trust me, like Fionn does?
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Please, no pressure, I... I don't want to be a burden on you, or anyone.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I just want to do something, anything. People like me have nothing left to lose as is.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: If I can bring something or other to the rest of the Tarans, then I want to do it. If my legs will still walk forward, then I want to go with you.
attributes.name: Moran

attributes.content: I think that's fine. Reed, for now, let's go together. How about it?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: To the red-haired Vouivre, the question's not one Reed needs to respond to, because she starts pulling Reed along before an answer even comes.
Reed takes a glance back at their visitor. She knows Moran has night blindness, and needs someone to guide the way when darkness falls.
With little time to hesitate, Reed extends a hand to Moran.
...Let's go.
attributes.name: Reed

attributes.content: Here you finally are, Miss Harmonie. I was beginning to think I'd never see you today.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: A wine tasting courtesy of the Viscount? How could I ever miss it?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: But of course, but of course. A friend of the Marquess of Trent! You're the Viscount's guest of honor.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: It's all thanks to your introducing me that I closed out that bit of prior business. I've been looking for an opportunity to thank you all this time.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Oh, it was quite nothing, Mr. Hall.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I've no noble personage, or even property in my name. At most, I'm just a messenger, scampering around so the ones in charge don't have to.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: (Toasts)
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Who might he be...?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: The council's pet. A Mr. Fischer.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Oh? Well, I've certainly never heard of him before.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: He only transferred to this county a short while ago. Youngsters like him tend to have to break their backs a little if they want a quick promotion.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Heheh. A universal truth, no?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You're too modest.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Oh, yes, I hear from some friends that the Dukes' armies are very frequently on the move now. They've put every core city of their duchies under strict martial law.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: You've always been on top of the news... could you lend me a sly word, whether war seems imminent?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: The papers certainly forecast it, don't they? After all, the Dukes' fleets did trundle up to Londinium's walls some while ago.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: I'm not much concerned with the Sarkaz. I'm referring to between the Dukes... ahem, based on hearsay, that is. Just hearsay.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: There's been a lot of Originium fuel circulating into County Trent. The Marquess and the Duke of Caster have always been jolly with each other, but County Trent and the Iron Duke's duchy share a border...
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: My, my, Mr. Hall, all intercity fuel trade requires inspection and approval. I presume you have some very good friends in municipal management, no?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Ha... haha, just for business purposes.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Miss Harmonie, you might not follow the war too closely, but... you came in from another city, didn't you?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: You've been fortunate not to run into any hassle when you did, but I do ask you take care on the return journey.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: I hear it's hideous in the villages beyond the nomadic cities. There's rebel elements popping up now and then. Even a case of arson a few days ago.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: What sort of rebel elements are these to earn your attention?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Attention is a strong word—similar things happen in spades anywhere the bumpkins live.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: It's that fire that's strange... hahah. This might not be true, so pretend I'm just telling you about some country tale.
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Eyewitnesses say that fire wasn't quite your ordinary one. It was ferocious as an explosion, but not a hint of Originium explosives was found where it happened. And the nightmarish effort it took to extinguish it...
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: Unusual fire.
All too likely to be a coincidence, but all too familiar of a description to her.
Could it be... Loughshinny?
Harmonie is stunned.
'The Brigadier's' warning has certainly roused some anxieties deep in her heart. Ever since that Rhodes Island ship had sailed into Victoria, she'd been absent any hold of information on Loughshinny.
Someone, without a doubt, had been helping Rhodes Island cover their tracks. Clearly, this pharmaceutical company was not as simple as she first assumed.
And on the same coin, a Loughshinny aboard Rhodes Island would be a Loughshinny immensely difficult for the rest of Victoria's powers to find.
So why... why would Loughshinny leave the ship?
Why would she surface somewhere so close to Eblana?
From behind Harmonie, there is a gaze.
Her every move has been closely watched since the second she stepped into the ballroom.
But it is this moment when the gaze truly focuses on her.
Miss Harmonie?
attributes.name: Enthusiastic Merchant

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I was just thinking about the dance tonight. Say, what color earrings would I be best off wearing?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...Sir, I assume you've seen the relevant dossier, as well as all my reports.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I suggest we commence operation immediately...
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Very well done, youngster. Have you tried the whiskey-filled chocolates out on the table?
attributes.name: Screened Woman's Voice

attributes.content: I hope you're well, Duke of Caster. I didn't expect you would grace this party, let alone be waiting here.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Who could miss such a grand soirée? Just listening to the chamber performance blows my cares away, even from behind my partition.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I do hope you're enjoying yourself too.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: I'm... still on duty. I can't be complacent.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Our every effort is made so that the masses can enjoy their serene lives.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Intelligence officers may be the lookouts, forced to keep a tense nerve even in times of peace, but you'll have your serenity one day.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: Lest I forget. How's your health?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: My gratitude for your concern, Duke. It floors me that you note the infection of an average intelligence officer like myself.
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Fischer

attributes.content: Don't be nervous. You're not hiding anything. As I say, you've done very well.
attributes.name: Duke of Caster

attributes.content: By way of a reward, would you like a promotion after your mission is over, or would you like to quit?
attributes.name: Duke of Caster
